metadata.feature_description: API endpoint for retrieving contextual data specific to individual modules

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Retrieve context data for valid module types

steps.action: Log in as SuperUser and navigate to Community Analytics dashboard
steps.expected: Community Analytics dashboard should load showing module tabs
steps.actual: Successfully navigated to Community Analytics dashboard under Dashboard > Community Analytics. Tabs visible: Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Events, Ideas, Wiki

steps.expected: API should return 200 OK with context data
steps.actual: API returned 200 OK with data: {moduleName: 'Answers', engagementPercent: 0, percentProgress: 0}

steps.action: Call GetModuleContextData API for all valid module types (Blogs, Discussions, Social Events, Ideas, Wiki)
steps.expected: Each API call should return 200 OK with consistent data structure
steps.actual: All module types returned 200 OK with consistent structure: {moduleName, engagementPercent, percentProgress}

steps.expected: API should handle invalid module name appropriately
steps.actual: API returned 500 Internal Server Error with empty body, indicating the invalid module name is not recognized

steps.action: Compare API response structure across all valid module types
steps.expected: All responses should have the same data structure
steps.actual: All valid module types (Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Social Events, Ideas, Wiki) return consistent JSON structure with three properties: moduleName (string), engagementPercent (number), percentProgress (number)

steps.expected: User should be logged out and see Login/Register links
steps.actual: Successfully logged out, page shows Register | Login links

steps.expected: API should deny access to unauthenticated users
steps.actual: API returned 401 Unauthorized with message 'Authorization has been denied for this request.' - Permission enforcement working correctly

observations: The GetModuleContextData API endpoint is located at /en-us/API/personabar/CommunityAnalytics/GetModuleContextData
The API requires the following parameters: period, startDate, endDate, comparativeTerm, moduleName
Valid module names are: Answers, Blogs, Discussions, Social Events, Ideas, Wiki
The API is protected by MenuPermission attribute requiring 'Evoq.CommunityAnalytics' menu access and LicenseCheck
Response data contains engagement metrics specific to each community module type
The Community Analytics UI uses GetModuleDashboardInfo API for dashboard data, while GetModuleContextData provides supplementary context
